title: The Latest: Chad Reed
excerpt: Chad Reed to miss Seattle and Denver.
author: Lewis Phillips
content:
Subscribe to MX Vice on YouTube.

Follow @MXVice on Instagram.

Chad Reed appears to be ready for his assault on the 2020 Monster Energy Supercross season, which will be his last one as a professional racer. Reed has announced that he will hang up his boots after the last race in Salt Lake City and compete in the series as a full privateer with his own team – backing from Mountain Motorsports will help a lot with that. Everything has been chucked together at the last minute but he will be ready for Anaheim 1 after putting in some eighteen-hour days recently.

An interesting update on his programme has come to light now, as it turns out that he will not be competing at all seventeen rounds. Reed mentioned on social media that he will only be at fifteen of the stops – car racing commitments mean that he will miss Seattle and Denver. A fan did ask Reed what would happen if he was in the hunt in the series standings but he replied by simply saying, "That would be a good problem to have."

When Chad Reed lines up at Anaheim 1 – an event that has been very kind to him in the past – it will mark his two hundred and fiftieth start in Monster Energy Supercross, a new record.

Words: Lewis Phillips | Lead Image: Ray Archer
